name: sfchronicle
text:
Among the charges: that the court failed to be equitable and inclusive for people of color.

https://t.co/s2GO6LfChj

name: sfchronicle
text:
Owners of Berkeley’s hit Mexican restaurant Comal say takeout-focused restaurant better suited to realities of COVID-19, so they’re opening a second Comal Next Door in Oakland.

https://t.co/RH45bj8p5z

name: sfchronicle
text:
Baseball could be heading toward a labor shutdown in 2022, according to Bill Gould, professor emeritus at Stanford Law School who helped end the 1994-95 MLB players’ strike.

https://t.co/deG6abUZQH

name: sfchronicle
text:
All but five California counties - including four in the Bay Area - have received approval to move into Stage 3 of reopening, where services like indoor dining, fitness centers and hotels can begin to reopen and gatherings can involve more people.

https://t.co/x35bHgN1Wf

name: sfchronicle
text:
Here's a list of more than 140 Bay Area restaurants that are now open for outdoor dining:

https://t.co/GlPCnHVHK9

name: sfchronicle
text:
Thousands of people gathered for rallies and marches around the Bay Area to demonstrate against racism, police brutality and participate in a nationwide “day of action” known as Juneteenth, which marks the end of slavery in the United States.
https://t.co/p738Af07G4

name: sfchronicle
text:
Warriors guard Steph Curry and Clarence B. Jones, who helped write Martin Luther King Jr.'s iconic "I Have a Dream" speech, discuss the protests sweeping the nation, voicing a need for love and compassion in tense times.
https://t.co/aIgiFkv6jl

name: sfchronicle
text:
Over decades, California has worked to make voting an easier, more user-friendly experience ⁠— and the changes have worked.

The state has more registered voters than the total population of every other state but Texas and Florida.

https://t.co/mqOHzs86Pn

name: sfchronicle
text:
Can you handle fake crowd noise on a televised sports event? 

@Bruce_Jenkins1 talks about the new trend that has become popular overseas: https://t.co/Z2Ke5s0AA2

name: sfchronicle
text:
“Quaran-team” 

“Covid-crew” 

“Pandemic pod” 

These terms are used to describe a form of socializing now permitted in Marin County. Members of a household are permitted to join with members of other households for a social bubble of up to 12.

Updates >> https://t.co/faw0pubvOe

name: sfchronicle
text:
“Black Climbers Matter” signs have popped up around Berkeley after a climbing coach posted a video describing her pain after hearing that children in her care were called racial slurs while at Indian Rock Park.

 https://t.co/lkt1XT3IiS

name: sfchronicle
text:
For some reason, prison leaders had mingled men from a virus-swamped facility in Chino with previously healthy, uninfected members of the San Quentin population. 

Story by @JFagone and @MeganRCassidy: https://t.co/Var3M6NuJp

name: sfchronicle
text: The Chronicle asked readers to tell us who they would like to see honored at Coit Tower, and we received hundreds of responses. Here are some of the most-nominated reader submissions. Which one would you choose? https://t.co/eIE1Js0aNx

name: sfchronicle
text:
“There’s one thing that this virus has shown us, which is that we’re only as healthy as the most vulnerable person in our community."

@michaelfranti wants to bring people together during the pandemic. His first step? A virtual concert. https://t.co/0ieYkcVbZS

name: sfchronicle
text: Gov. @GavinNewsom began the state's shelter-in-place on March 19. Where are we at now? Take a look here: https://t.co/sCHPXzZ8pA

name: sfchronicle
text:
David Perlman, the award-winning @SFChronicle science writer who retired at age 97, dies at 101. @SteveRubeSF and @KevinChron obituary. 

https://t.co/0XI5QDqxXT

name: sfchronicle
text: About 200 people paid their final respects to Sean Monterrosa, the 22-year-old San Francisco man who was fatally shot by a Vallejo police officer earlier this month. His family says Monterrosa was "kneeling and surrendering" when he was killed. https://t.co/Bu7Xzv247C

name: sfchronicle
text:
We've added to our list of Bay Area restaurants that are now open for outdoor dining:

https://t.co/U0LsgQ6KD5

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Junipero Serra statue in Golden Gate Park has been toppled. Rope was used to tear the statue from its base, according to videos on social media. Serra was founder of the California Mission system created by Spanish colonizers. 

Live updates >> https://t.co/psb5W7GzMl https://t.co/CIkgQPmJCT

name: sfchronicle
text: More than three months have passed since the Bay Area's shelter-in-place began. Here's a look at how drastically life has changed: https://t.co/2NklOizm30

name: sfchronicle
text:
Being a survivor of the coronavirus doesn't mean you've recovered. Those who have battled the virus say they haven't necessarily defeated it and their lives will never be the same. Here are some of their stories.

https://t.co/tzQW8gop0s
